Alhambra.Constance Perkins House:
The Constance Perkins House is a house designed by Richard Neutra and built in Pasadena, California, 1952-55.


== Design and construction ==
In 1947, Constance Perkins started working as a professor of Art History at Occidental College and here she met Richard Neutra, eventually asking him to design her home.
When Neutra was designing the house for her "he had to reexamine the single-family home and rework conventional patterns of the type." The house itself sits on a little hill in Pasadena, California.
